title: Kandy Kennedy
text:
Kandy Kennedy (born 17 February 1996) is an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays for the <a href="Glebe%20%28rugby%20league%20team%29">Glebe Dirty Reds</a> in the <a href="NSWRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NSWRL Women's Premiership</a>.
She previously played for the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, Kennedy was raised in <a href="Bathurst%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Bathurst, New South Wales</a>. Her father, <a href="William%20Kennedy%20%28rugby%20league%2C%20born%201969%29">William</a>, played 61 first grade games for the <a href="Balmain%20Tigers">Balmain Tigers</a> and her brother, <a href="William%20Kennedy%20%28rugby%20league%2C%20born%201997%29">William Jr</a>, currently plays for the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a>.
Playing career.
In 2013, at 16-years old, Kennedy represented the <a href="Indigenous%20All%20Stars%20%28rugby%20league%29">Indigenous All Stars</a>. In 2014, she again represented the Indigenous All Stars, starting on the against the Women's All Stars.
In 2017, while representing the Indigenous All Stars for the third time, she tore her <a href="anterior%20cruciate%20ligament">anterior cruciate ligament</a> (ACL).
In 2018, she joined the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> team. In Round 3 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20Women%27s%20season">2018 NRL Women's season</a>, she made her debut for the Roosters in their 26–0 win over the <a href="St%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St George Illawarra Dragons</a>. On 30 September 2018, she came off the bench in the Roosters' <a href="2018%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a> loss to the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>.
On 15 February 2019, she started at for the Indigenous All Stars in their 4–8 loss to the Maori All Stars.
In 2019 and 2020, she played for the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> in the <a href="NSWRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NSWRL Women's Premiership</a>.
In 2021, she joined the <a href="Glebe%20%28rugby%20league%20team%29">Glebe Dirty Reds</a> for their inaugural season in the <a href="NSWRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NSWRL Women's Premiership</a>.
